title: Viagra user, 26, says his ‘month-long’ erection has left him impotent
text:
Nat Thind claims he’s gone from ‘having a healthy sex life to no sex life’ (Picture: SWNS)

A Viagra user claims to have gone from ‘having a healthy sex life to no sex life’ after doctors ‘mutilated’ his penis trying to relieve him of a ‘month-long’ erection.

Nat Thind, 26, bought the over-the-counter medication back in June after taking it several times before without incident.

But this time the electrician ended up in hospital after suffering a priapism – a painful long-lasting erection.

When surgery failed doctors spent three days prodding and probing Nat in a bid to relieve him before he finally went flaccid naturally.

But Mr Thind wrote on a GoFundMe page: ‘In the months following and through speaking to other doctors, I have found that they did not really know what they were doing and it turns out they just “had a go”.

Nat Thind says he ended up with an erection that lasted four weeks (Picture: SWNS)

The electrician suffered a priapism – a long-lasting painful erection (Picture: SWNS)

He had taken the medication several times before without incident (Picture: SWNS)

‘In their attempts at surgery they caused severe nerve damage. As a result I am now left with a mutilated penis, a numb tip, the inability to get an erection or achieve orgasm, random shooting and burning pains and penile fibrosis.

‘Going from having a healthy sex life to no sex life is devastating and is taking its toll on relationships. It is most definitely not easy living with this dark secret that I feel so ashamed of.’

Mr Thind took the recommend dose of one Viagra pill on June 17, the Daily Star reported.

He said he has been unable to get and erection at all in the nine weeks since and has started the fundraising page to help pay towards travel to Germany to see specialists.

‘There’s no point in me being depressed about what’s happened,’ he told The Star.

‘I have even got to the point where I can see the funny side of what’s happened. I had a healthy sex life before and obviously that’s impossible for me now.’
